question.content: Does, among the daily (or almost daily) headaches, the pain meet the criteria of migraine (with or without aura) during at least 8 days in the month or is relieved by triptans or ergotamine?

Is the pain constant, always on the same side, periodically with anatomical symptoms on the side of the pain (tearing, eye redness, watery discharge from the nasal passages) and is relieved by indomethacin?
Did the headache, which is ongoing, begin on one particular day and from this day remains uninterrupted?
Is the pain accompanied by other symptoms (other than sporadic nausea)?
Consider secondary headache occurring every day.

source.linkDescription: Rożniecki J.J., dr hab. n. med., Międzynarodowa klasyfikacja bólów głowy, wydanie 3. (część 2.)
